column4: Hello, I am trying to set up a hostname script that sets hostnames according to their MAC address. This list of MAC address and respective hostnames is derived from a properly formatted text file. The script works, we just need to have it working upon startup, any ideas?
if you mean running it upon startup, call it in the ~/.bashrc file
If you aren't losing much, save time and just reinstall
We got it running on startup, but it says but it doesn't read the file.
We are using a while read
but it works when you run it manually? it's a bash script I suppose?
It doesn't give an error, it just doesn't change the hostname, we did some debugging and established that it does not read the file
maybe the script is executed as a user who does not have read access to the file?
or the file is located on a drive that is mounted after your script executes
but it's very strange there is no error, that'd indicate the file it reads is in fact empty :/
Could it be because the path name of the file it reads to get the addresses is relative and not absolute?
it's possible, the working directory has to be the same (pwd)
We got it, path needed to be absolute
Thanks a lot for your help, much appreciated.
